meanings.definition: Not able to be reproduced or replicated.
meanings.sent1: The artist's unique painting style was irreproducible by anyone else.
meanings.sent2: The scientist's groundbreaking experiment results were irreproducible in subsequent trials.
meanings.sent3: The recipe for Grandma's secret sauce was irreproducible, leaving everyone craving more.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter was irreproducible, bringing joy to all who heard it.
meanings.sent5: The magic trick was so irreproducible that it left the audience in awe.

meanings.definition: Not capable of being copied or imitated.
meanings.sent1: The designer's innovative fashion creations were irreproducible by other brands.
meanings.sent2: The author's writing style was so unique that it was irreproducible by others.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's hilarious jokes were irreproducible, making him a one-of-a-kind talent.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's incredible speed was irreproducible, setting a new record in the sport.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the sunset was so irreproducible that it took everyone's breath away.
